instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: macbook air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no trackpad/mouse
threads.message:
liquid damage macbook air no power. 

<SIGNAL>P5V_S4RS3_VFB1_R</SIGNAL> had a broken trace. jumped it and turns on now 

but trackpad and mouse dont work

i can do smc reset but just option alone doesnt work

[B][U]J4800[/U]
Pin 10:[/B] 3.32V
[B]Pin 14:[/B] 5.10V
[B]Pin 19:[/B] 3.40V


i dont have an extra trackpad and k/b to try. i doubt its that. they look clean

any idea what to do next 

tia

threads.title: macbook air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no trackpad/mouse
threads.message: Main voltages seem ok. First thing to try now are another trackpad and cable. Cable is the most likely problem. You could beep out all the pins from the board to the trackpad to confirm the cable is good.

threads.title: macbook air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no trackpad/mouse
threads.message: i did that. all continuity is present. ill check out another trackpad and cable tomorrow and then ill go from there. thx
